info.title: Order Management
info.description: The Walmart Order Management APIs help Sellers to manage customer’s Sales Orders and to stay up-to-date on orders fulfillment, which orders to fulfill, and when to fulfill them.

post.description:
Updates the status of order lines to **Shipped** and trigger the charge to the customer. You must acknowledge your orders before sending a shipping update to avoid underselling. After canceling your order, update the inventory for the canceled order and send it in the next inventory feed. An order line, once marked as shipped, cannot be updated.

**NOTE: shipDateTime must be in UTC. **

The response to a successful call contains the order with the shipped line item.

#### Process Mode

The processMode parameter allows the Seller to track and update any shipment information after the order has already shipped. This parameter is used to differentiate between the first shipment and subsequent shipments, and track information updates post shipment. This is an optional parameter, and if not passed it will be considered as a regular shipment update. The supported value for processMode is listed in the table below.

The following table describes the processMode parameter:

| Description | Required |
| --- | --- |
| Allows tracking of order shipment information | Yes |

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?>
<order
  xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/orders"
  xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders"
  xmlns:ns4="http://walmart.com/">
    <purchaseOrderId>2575193093772</purchaseOrderId>
    <customerOrderId>4021603841173</customerOrderId>
    <customerEmailId>mgr@walmartlabs.com</customerEmailId>
    <orderDate>2016-05-11T22:55:28.000Z</orderDate>
    <shippingInfo>
        <phone>6502248603</phone>
        <estimatedDeliveryDate>2016-05-20T17:00:00.000Z</estimatedDeliveryDate>
        <estimatedShipDate>2016-05-16T17:00:00.000Z</estimatedShipDate>
        <methodCode>Standard</methodCode>
        <postalAddress>
            <name>Joe Doe PGOMS</name>
            <address1>860 W Cal Ave</address1>
            <address2>Seat # 860C.2.176</address2>
            <city>Sunnyvale</city>
            <state>CA</state>
            <postalCode>94086</postalCode>
            <country>USA</country>
            <addressType>RESIDENTIAL</addressType>
        </postalAddress>
    </shippingInfo>
    <orderLines>
        <orderLine>
            <lineNumber>2</lineNumber>
            <shipFromCountry>CA</shipFromCountry>
            <item>
                <productName>Garmin Refurbished nuvi 2595LMT 5 GPS w Lifetime Maps and Traffic</productName>
                <sku>GRMN100201</sku>
            </item>
            <charges>
                <charge>
                    <chargeType>PRODUCT</chargeType>
                    <chargeName>ItemPrice</chargeName>
                    <chargeAmount>
                        <currency>USD</currency>
                        <amount>124.98</amount>
                    </chargeAmount>
                    <tax>
                        <taxName>Tax1</taxName>
                        <taxAmount>
                            <currency>USD</currency>
                            <amount>10.93</amount>
                        </taxAmount>
                    </tax>
                </charge>
            </charges>
            <orderLineQuantity>
                <unitOfMeasurement>EACH</unitOfMeasurement>
                <amount>1</amount>
            </orderLineQuantity>
            <statusDate>2016-06-03T23:44:41.000Z</statusDate>
            <orderLineStatuses>
                <orderLineStatus>
                    <status>Shipped</status>
                    <statusQuantity>
                        <unitOfMeasurement>EACH</unitOfMeasurement>
                        <amount>1</amount>
                    </statusQuantity>
                    <trackingInfo>
                        <shipDateTime>2016-06-27T05:30:15.000Z</shipDateTime>
                        <carrierName>
                            <carrier>FedEx</carrier>
                        </carrierName>
                        <methodCode>Standard</methodCode>
                        <trackingNumber>12333634122</trackingNumber>
                        <trackingURL>http://www.fedex.com</trackingURL>
                    </trackingInfo>
                </orderLineStatus>
            </orderLineStatuses>
        </orderLine>
    </orderLines>
</order>

post.description:
Refunds one or more order lines that have been shipped.

The response to a successful call contains the order with the refunded line item.

You can only refund an order line that has a status of **Shipped**.

The value for the **amount** element in the refund must be negative. The magnitude of the amount specified as the refund cannot be greater than the original amount that was charged for the line.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<orderRefund
  xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders"
  xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/">
    <purchaseOrderId>2575193093772</purchaseOrderId>
    <orderLines>
        <orderLine>
            <lineNumber>1</lineNumber>
            <refunds>
                <refund>
                    <refundComments>test test</refundComments>
                    <refundCharges>
                        <refundCharge>
                            <refundReason>DamagedItem</refundReason>
                            <charge>
                                <chargeType>PRODUCT</chargeType>
                                <chargeName>Item Price</chargeName>
                                <chargeAmount>
                                    <currency>USD</currency>
                                    <amount>-10.02</amount>
                                </chargeAmount>
                                <tax>
                                    <taxName>Item Price Tax</taxName>
                                    <taxAmount>
                                        <currency>USD</currency>
                                        <amount>-5.03</amount>
                                    </taxAmount>
                                </tax>
                            </charge>
                        </refundCharge>
                        <refundCharge>
                            <refundReason>TaxExemptCustomer</refundReason>
                            <charge>
                                <chargeType>SHIPPING</chargeType>
                                <chargeName>Shipping Price</chargeName>
                                <chargeAmount>
                                    <currency>USD</currency>
                                    <amount>-1.02</amount>
                                </chargeAmount>
                                <tax>
                                    <taxName>Shipping Tax</taxName>
                                    <taxAmount>
                                        <currency>USD</currency>
                                        <amount>-0.05</amount>
                                    </taxAmount>
                                </tax>
                            </charge>
                        </refundCharge>
                    </refundCharges>
                </refund>
            </refunds>
        </orderLine>
    </orderLines>
</orderRefund>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?>
<ns3:order
  xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/orders"
  xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders"
  xmlns:ns4="http://walmart.com/">
    <ns3:purchaseOrderId>2575193093772</ns3:purchaseOrderId>
    <ns3:customerOrderId>4021603841173</ns3:customerOrderId>
    <ns3:customerEmailId>mgr@walmartlabs.com</ns3:customerEmailId>
    <ns3:orderDate>2016-05-11T22:55:28.000Z</ns3:orderDate>
    <ns3:shippingInfo>
        <ns3:phone>6502248603</ns3:phone>
        <ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>2016-05-20T17:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>
        <ns3:estimatedShipDate>2016-05-16T17:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedShipDate>
        <ns3:methodCode>Standard</ns3:methodCode>
        <ns3:postalAddress>
            <ns3:name>Joe Doe PGOMS</ns3:name>
            <ns3:address1>860 W Cal Ave</ns3:address1>
            <ns3:address2>Seat # 860C.2.176</ns3:address2>
            <ns3:city>Sunnyvale</ns3:city>
            <ns3:state>CA</ns3:state>
            <ns3:postalCode>94086</ns3:postalCode>
            <ns3:country>USA</ns3:country>
            <ns3:addressType>RESIDENTIAL</ns3:addressType>
        </ns3:postalAddress>
    </ns3:shippingInfo>
    <ns3:orderLines>
        <ns3:orderLine>
            <ns3:lineNumber>2</ns3:lineNumber>
            <ns3:item>
                <ns3:productName>Garmin Refurbished nuvi 2595LMT 5 GPS w Lifetime Maps and Traffic</ns3:productName>
                <ns3:sku>GRMN100201</ns3:sku>
            </ns3:item>
            <ns3:charges>
                <ns3:charge>
                    <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                    <ns3:chargeName>ItemPrice</ns3:chargeName>
                    <ns3:chargeAmount>
                        <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                        <ns3:amount>124.98</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:chargeAmount>
                    <ns3:tax>
                        <ns3:taxName>Tax1</ns3:taxName>
                        <ns3:taxAmount>
                            <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                            <ns3:amount>10.93</ns3:amount>
                        </ns3:taxAmount>
                    </ns3:tax>
                </ns3:charge>
                <ns3:charge>
                    <ns3:chargeType>SHIPPING</ns3:chargeType>
                    <ns3:chargeName>Shipping</ns3:chargeName>
                    <ns3:chargeAmount>
                        <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                        <ns3:amount>2.00</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:chargeAmount>
                    <ns3:tax>
                        <ns3:taxName>Tax2</ns3:taxName>
                        <ns3:taxAmount>
                            <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                            <ns3:amount>0.19</ns3:amount>
                        </ns3:taxAmount>
                    </ns3:tax>
                </ns3:charge>
            </ns3:charges>
            <ns3:orderLineQuantity>
                <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
            </ns3:orderLineQuantity>
            <ns3:statusDate>2016-06-03T23:48:00.000Z</ns3:statusDate>
            <ns3:orderLineStatuses>
                <ns3:orderLineStatus>
                    <ns3:status>Shipped</ns3:status>
                    <ns3:statusQuantity>
                        <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                        <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:statusQuantity>
                    <ns3:trackingInfo>
                        <ns3:shipDateTime>2016-06-27T05:30:15.000Z</ns3:shipDateTime>
                        <ns3:carrierName>
                            <ns3:carrier>FedEx</ns3:carrier>
                        </ns3:carrierName>
                        <ns3:methodCode>Standard</ns3:methodCode>
                        <ns3:trackingNumber>12333634122</ns3:trackingNumber>
                        <ns3:trackingURL>http://www.fedex.com</ns3:trackingURL>
                    </ns3:trackingInfo>
                </ns3:orderLineStatus>
            </ns3:orderLineStatuses>
            <ns3:refund>
                <ns3:refundCharges>
                    <ns3:refundCharge>
                        <ns3:refundReason>DamagedItem</ns3:refundReason>
                        <ns3:charge>
                            <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                            <ns3:chargeName>Damaged</ns3:chargeName>
                            <ns3:chargeAmount>
                                <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                                <ns3:amount>-10.02</ns3:amount>
                            </ns3:chargeAmount>
                            <ns3:tax>
                                <ns3:taxName>Product</ns3:taxName>
                                <ns3:taxAmount>
                                    <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                                    <ns3:amount>-5.03</ns3:amount>
                                </ns3:taxAmount>
                            </ns3:tax>
                        </ns3:charge>
                    </ns3:refundCharge>
                    <ns3:refundCharge>
                        <ns3:refundReason>TaxExemptCustomer</ns3:refundReason>
                        <ns3:charge>
                            <ns3:chargeType>SHIPPING</ns3:chargeType>
                            <ns3:chargeName>Tax Exempt</ns3:chargeName>
                            <ns3:chargeAmount>
                                <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                                <ns3:amount>-1.02</ns3:amount>
                            </ns3:chargeAmount>
                            <ns3:tax>
                                <ns3:taxName>Shipping</ns3:taxName>
                                <ns3:taxAmount>
                                    <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                                    <ns3:amount>-0.05</ns3:amount>
                                </ns3:taxAmount>
                            </ns3:tax>
                        </ns3:charge>
                    </ns3:refundCharge>
                </ns3:refundCharges>
            </ns3:refund>
        </ns3:orderLine>
    </ns3:orderLines>
</ns3:order>

post.description:
You can cancel one or more order lines. You must include a purchaseOrderId when cancelling an order line. After cancelling your order, update the inventory for the cancelled order and send it in the next inventory feed.

The response to a successful call contains the order with the cancelled line item.

Cancellation Reasons supported:
- CANCEL_BY_SELLER
- CUSTOMER_REQUESTED_SELLER_TO_CANCEL

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ns3:order xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/orders" xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders" xmlns:ns4="http://walmart.com/">
    <ns3:purchaseOrderId>3225224</ns3:purchaseOrderId>
    <ns3:customerOrderId>4324242T5</ns3:customerOrderId>
    <ns3:customerEmailId>2WR4TTETGERGR@relay.walmart.com</ns3:customerEmailId>
    <ns3:orderDate>2018-02-16T18:16:59.000Z</ns3:orderDate>
    <ns3:shippingInfo>
        <ns3:phone>14325245</ns3:phone>
        <ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>2018-02-28T04:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>
        <ns3:estimatedShipDate>2018-02-17T04:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedShipDate>
        <ns3:methodCode>Value</ns3:methodCode>
        <ns3:postalAddress>
            <ns3:name>SID </ns3:name>
            <ns3:address1>300 DUMMY  Ln</ns3:address1>
            <ns3:city>CITY</ns3:city>
            <ns3:state>STATE</ns3:state>
            <ns3:postalCode>234</ns3:postalCode>
            <ns3:country>USA</ns3:country>
            <ns3:addressType>RESIDENTIAL</ns3:addressType>
        </ns3:postalAddress>
    </ns3:shippingInfo>
    <ns3:orderLines>
        <ns3:orderLine>
            <ns3:lineNumber>1</ns3:lineNumber>
            <ns3:item>
                <ns3:productName>Little </ns3:productName>
                <ns3:sku>SKU232435435</ns3:sku>
            </ns3:item>
            <ns3:charges>
                <ns3:charge>
                    <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                    <ns3:chargeName>ItemPrice</ns3:chargeName>
                    <ns3:chargeAmount>
                        <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                        <ns3:amount>0.00</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:chargeAmount>
                    <ns3:tax>
                        <ns3:taxName>Tax1</ns3:taxName>
                        <ns3:taxAmount>
                            <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                            <ns3:amount>0.00</ns3:amount>
                        </ns3:taxAmount>
                    </ns3:tax>
                </ns3:charge>
            </ns3:charges>
            <ns3:orderLineQuantity>
                <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
            </ns3:orderLineQuantity>
            <ns3:statusDate>2018-07-25T23:18:12.000Z</ns3:statusDate>
            <ns3:orderLineStatuses>
                <ns3:orderLineStatus>
                    <ns3:status>Cancelled</ns3:status>
                    <ns3:statusQuantity>
                        <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                        <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:statusQuantity>
                </ns3:orderLineStatus>
            </ns3:orderLineStatuses>
            <ns3:refund>
                <ns3:refundCharges>
                    <ns3:refundCharge>
                        <ns3:refundReason>Others</ns3:refundReason>
                        <ns3:charge>
                            <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                            <ns3:chargeName>Others</ns3:chargeName>
                            <ns3:chargeAmount>
                                <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                                <ns3:amount>0</ns3:amount>
                            </ns3:chargeAmount>
                        </ns3:charge>
                    </ns3:refundCharge>
                </ns3:refundCharges>
            </ns3:refund>
            <ns3:fulfillment>
                <ns3:fulfillmentOption>S2H</ns3:fulfillmentOption>
                <ns3:shipMethod>VALUE</ns3:shipMethod>
                <ns3:pickUpDateTime>2018-02-22T04:00:00.000Z</ns3:pickUpDateTime>
            </ns3:fulfillment>
        </ns3:orderLine>
        <ns3:orderLine>
            <ns3:lineNumber>2</ns3:lineNumber>
            <ns3:item>
                <ns3:productName>Little n</ns3:productName>
                <ns3:sku>sku14325434</ns3:sku>
            </ns3:item>
            <ns3:charges>
                <ns3:charge>
                    <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                    <ns3:chargeName>ItemPrice</ns3:chargeName>
                    <ns3:chargeAmount>
                        <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                        <ns3:amount>30.00</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:chargeAmount>
                    <ns3:tax>
                        <ns3:taxName>Tax1</ns3:taxName>
                        <ns3:taxAmount>
                            <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                            <ns3:amount>2.85</ns3:amount>
                        </ns3:taxAmount>
                    </ns3:tax>
                </ns3:charge>
            </ns3:charges>
            <ns3:orderLineQuantity>
                <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
            </ns3:orderLineQuantity>
            <ns3:statusDate>2018-04-04T23:12:53.000Z</ns3:statusDate>
            <ns3:orderLineStatuses>
                <ns3:orderLineStatus>
                    <ns3:status>Acknowledged</ns3:status>
                    <ns3:statusQuantity>
                        <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                        <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:statusQuantity>
                </ns3:orderLineStatus>
            </ns3:orderLineStatuses>
            <ns3:fulfillment>
                <ns3:fulfillmentOption>S2H</ns3:fulfillmentOption>
                <ns3:shipMethod>VALUE</ns3:shipMethod>
                <ns3:pickUpDateTime>2018-02-22T04:00:00.000Z</ns3:pickUpDateTime>
            </ns3:fulfillment>
        </ns3:orderLine>
    </ns3:orderLines>
</ns3:order>

post.description:
You can use this API to acknowledge an entire order, including all of its order lines. Walmart requires a seller to acknowledge orders within **four** hours of receipt of the order, except in extenuating circumstances.

The response to a successful call contains the acknowledged order.

In general, only orders that are in a **Created** state should be acknowledged. As a good practice, acknowledge your orders to avoid underselling. Orders that are in an **Acknowledged** state can be re-acknowledged, possibly in response to an error response from an earlier call to acknowledge order. Orders with line items that are shipped or canceled should not be re-acknowledged.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?>
<ns3:order
  xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/orders">
    <ns3:purchaseOrderId>2575193093772</ns3:purchaseOrderId>
    <ns3:customerOrderId>4021603841173</ns3:customerOrderId>
    <ns3:customerEmailId>mgr@walmartlabs.com</ns3:customerEmailId>
    <ns3:orderDate>2016-05-11T22:55:28.000Z</ns3:orderDate>
    <ns3:shippingInfo>
        <ns3:phone>6502248603</ns3:phone>
        <ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>2016-05-20T17:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>
        <ns3:estimatedShipDate>2016-05-16T17:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedShipDate>
        <ns3:methodCode>Standard</ns3:methodCode>
        <ns3:postalAddress>
            <ns3:name>Joe Doe PGOMS</ns3:name>
            <ns3:address1>860 W Cal Ave</ns3:address1>
            <ns3:address2>Seat # 860C.2.176</ns3:address2>
            <ns3:city>Sunnyvale</ns3:city>
            <ns3:state>CA</ns3:state>
            <ns3:postalCode>94086</ns3:postalCode>
            <ns3:country>USA</ns3:country>
            <ns3:addressType>RESIDENTIAL</ns3:addressType>
        </ns3:postalAddress>
    </ns3:shippingInfo>
    <ns3:orderLines>
        <ns3:orderLine>
            <ns3:lineNumber>2</ns3:lineNumber>
            <ns3:item>
                <ns3:productName>Garmin Refurbished nuvi 2595LMT 5 GPS w Lifetime Maps and Traffic</ns3:productName>
                <ns3:sku>GRMN100201</ns3:sku>
            </ns3:item>
            <ns3:charges>
                <ns3:charge>
                    <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                    <ns3:chargeName>ItemPrice</ns3:chargeName>
                    <ns3:chargeAmount>
                        <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                        <ns3:amount>124.98</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:chargeAmount>
                    <ns3:tax>
                        <ns3:taxName>Tax1</ns3:taxName>
                        <ns3:taxAmount>
                            <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                            <ns3:amount>10.93</ns3:amount>
                        </ns3:taxAmount>
                    </ns3:tax>
                </ns3:charge>
            </ns3:charges>
            <ns3:orderLineQuantity>
                <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
            </ns3:orderLineQuantity>
            <ns3:statusDate>2016-06-03T23:32:51.000Z</ns3:statusDate>
            <ns3:orderLineStatuses>
                <ns3:orderLineStatus>
                    <ns3:status>Acknowledged</ns3:status>
                    <ns3:statusQuantity>
                        <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                        <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:statusQuantity>
                </ns3:orderLineStatus>
            </ns3:orderLineStatuses>
        </ns3:orderLine>
    </ns3:orderLines>
</ns3:order>

get.description: Retrieves the details of all the orders for specified search criteria.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: A seller-provided Product ID

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: The customer order ID

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID. One customer may have multiple purchase orders.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status may be specified to return orders of that type. Valid statuses are: Created, Acknowledged, Shipped, and Cancelled.

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all purchase orders after that date. Use one of the following formats, based on UTC, ISO 8601. Date example: '2013-08-16' Timestamp example: '2013-08-16T10:30:15Z'

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: Limits orders returned to those created before this createdEndDate. Two formats, based on ISO 8601, are allowed: UTC date or timestamp. Examples: '2016-08-16T10:30:30.155Z' or '2016-08-16'.

parameters.name: fromExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Limits orders returned to those that have orderLines with an expected ship date after this fromExpectedShipDate. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: toExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Limits orders returned to those that have orderLines with an expected ship date before this toExpectedShipDate. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned.Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. This parameter must be boolean, e.g.: productInfo=true.

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?>
<list
  xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/orders"
  xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders"
  xmlns:ns4="http://walmart.com/">
    <meta>
        <totalCount>367</totalCount>
        <limit>10</limit>
        <nextCursor>?limit=10&hasMoreElements=true&soIndex=2&poIndex=2&sellerId=10&status=Created&createdStartDate=2016-01-01&createdEndDate=2016-06-03T22:45:16.377Z</nextCursor>
    </meta>
    <elements>
        <order>
            <purchaseOrderId>2575263094491</purchaseOrderId>
            <customerOrderId>4091603648841</customerOrderId>
            <customerEmailId>gsingh@walmartlabs.com</customerEmailId>
            <orderDate>2016-05-18T16:53:14.000Z</orderDate>
            <shippingInfo>
                <phone>2342423234</phone>
                <estimatedDeliveryDate>2016-06-22T06:00:00.000Z</estimatedDeliveryDate>
                <estimatedShipDate>2016-06-15T06:00:00.000Z</estimatedShipDate>
                <methodCode>Standard</methodCode>
                <postalAddress>
                    <name>PGOMS Walmart</name>
                    <address1>850 Cherry Avenue</address1>
                    <address2>Floor 5</address2>
                    <city>San Bruno</city>
                    <state>CA</state>

get.description: Retrieves an order detail for a specific purchaseOrderId

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. This parameter must be boolean, e.g.: productInfo=true.

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>

get.description: Retrieves the details of all the WFS orders for specified search criteria.

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: The customer order ID

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status may be specified to return orders of that type. Valid statuses are: Created, Shipped and Cancelled.

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all purchase orders after that date. Use one of the following formats, based on UTC, ISO 8601. Date example: '2013-08-16' Timestamp example: '2013-08-16T10:30:15Z'

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: Limits orders returned to those created before this createdEndDate. Two formats, based on ISO 8601, are allowed: UTC date or timestamp. Examples: '2016-08-16T10:30:30.155Z' or '2016-08-16'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned.Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting order offset for the current page

get.description:
Retrieves all the orders with line items that are in the "created" status, that is, these orders have been released from the Walmart Order Management System to the seller for processing. The released orders are the orders that are ready for a seller to fulfill.



---
**Note**

There is a maximum limit of 2000 orders that can be downloaded at a time. Attempting to download more than 2000 orders will return an error.

---

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all purchase orders after this date. Use epoch time format in seconds.

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: End Date for querying all purchase orders after this date. Use epoch time format in seconds.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. This parameter must be boolean, e.g.: productInfo=true.

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<list xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders" xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/orders" xmlns:ns4="http://walmart.com/">
    <meta>
        <totalCount>8</totalCount>
        <limit>1</limit>
        <nextCursor>?limit=1&hasMoreElements=true&soIndex=8&poIndex=1577014034085&sellerId=801&status=Created&createdStartDate=2016-11-01&createdEndDate=2016-12-12T22:50:46.014Z</nextCursor>
    </meta>

chargeType.description: The charge type for line items can be one of the following: PRODUCT or SHIPPING For details, refer to 'Charge Types'

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

charge.description: List of elements that make up a charge

ChargesType.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, assigned to each item in the XSD file.

ItemType.description: The information for the item on the orderLine

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

MoneyType.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

purchaseOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the seller's purchase order

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

customerEmailId.description: The email address of the customer for the sales order

orderDate.description: The date the customer submitted the sales order

cancellationReason.description: If order is cancelled, cancellationReason will explain the reason

OrderLineStatusType.description: Details about the Order Line status

orderLineStatus.description: Details about the Order Line status

OrderLineStatusesType.description: A list of statuses for the Order Line

lineNumber.description: The line number associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

shipFromCountry.description: The ship from country is associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

statusDate.description: The date shown on the recent order status

OrderLineType.description: Purchase Order line information for each item

orderLine.description: Purchase Order line information for each item

OrderLinesType.description: A list of order lines in the order

address1.description: The first line of the shipping address

address2.description: The second line of the shipping address

city.description: The city of the shipping address

state.description: The state of the shipping address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the shipping address

country.description: The country of the shipping address

PostalAddressType.description: Elements of the customer's postal address

RefundType.description: Details about any refund on the order

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: The estimated time and date for the delivery of the item. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2016-06-15T06:00:00Z'

estimatedShipDate.description: The estimated time and date when the item will be shipped. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2016-06-15T06:00:00Z'

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, Oneday, or Freight

ShippingInfoType.description: The shipping information provided by the customer to the seller

taxName.description: The name associated with the tax. Example: 'Sales Tax'

TaxType.description: Tax information for the charge, including taxName and taxAmount

shipDateTime.description: The date the package was shipped

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, Oneday, or Freight

trackingNumber.description: The shipment tracking number required for all non-Lettermail shipments

trackingURL.description: The URL for tracking the shipment

TrackingInfoType.description: List of information about the package shipment and tracking updates

ShipLineStatusType.description: Details about the Order Line status

orderLineStatus.description: Details about the Order Line status

ShipLineStatusesType.description: A list of status updates for that orderLine, including shipping status updates

shipFromCountry.description: The ship from country is associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

ShippingLineType.description: Information about one order line shipment

orderLine.description: Information about one order line shipment

ShippingLinesType.description: List of orderLines in the shipment

CancelLineStatusType.description: List of details about the cancellation status update

orderLineStatus.description: List of details about the cancellation status update

CancelLineStatusesType.description: Information to update the orderLine with cancellation details

CancelLineType.description: A list of orderLines to be cancelled

orderLine.description: A list of orderLines to be cancelled

totalCount.description: The totalCount returns the total number of available orders.

limit.description: The number of orders to be returned.

nextCursor.description: The nextCursor element contains the string that should be send as a query parameter to the subsequent GET call to get the next page of results.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: Header authentication with your Walmart channel type, which is passed in the WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE header. When using endpoints that require channel type authentication, you must pass the `channelType` option to the `Configuration` constructor.

consumerId.name: WM_CONSUMER.ID
consumerId.description: Header authentication with your Walmart consumer ID, which is passed in the WM_CONSUMER.ID header. This is always used in tandem with signature authentication (below). When using endpoints that require consumer ID authentication, you must pass the `consumerId` option to the `Configuration` constructor.

signature.name: WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE
signature.description: Request signature authentication. Request signatures are generated using a combination of request info, a timestamp, and your Walmart consumer ID and private key. The signature is passed in the WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE header. This is always used in tandem with consumer ID authentication (above). When using endpoints that require signature authentication, you must pass the `privateKey` and `consumerId` options to the `Configuration` constructor.
